alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 8:13PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Crook County through 900 PM MDT... At 813 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of New Haven to 3 miles north of Alva to 2 miles southwest of Cook Lake. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colony and Alva. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for northeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills
